alert.note: Alert for Avery (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 20 at 2:30PM EST until January 21 at 12:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 20 below zero. * WHERE...Avery County. * WHEN...Until noon EST Sunday. * IMPACTS...The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: A Wind Chill Advisory means that very cold air and strong winds will combine to generate low wind chills. This will result in frost bite and lead to hypothermia if precautions are not taken. If you must venture outdoors, make sure you wear a hat and gloves.
